paragraph: Christian, where the mystic himself is lifted up to divine adoration through initiatory rites. At the close of the consecration into the Isis mysteries the mystic was crowned with the palm crown,[119] he was placed on a pedestal and worshipped as Helios.[120] In the magic papyrus of the Mithraic liturgy published by Dieterich there is the ἱερός λόγος[121] of the consecrated one:
question: In the Isis mysteries, what symbol of honor was given to the initiate at the end of the consecration ceremony?
answer: At the end of the consecration into the Isis mysteries, the initiate was given a palm crown as a symbol of honor.
